sentence.text: They were dreadful , lacking organisation and committing a succession of hair-raising blunders .

Even for an experienced choreographer , the suspense could have been hair-raising .
Welcome to the strange , exciting , occasionally hair-raising but always fascinating world of house-hunting .

The most hair-raising operation at Honister was not digging the slate , but getting it down the fells to sheds where the material was riven and dressed for transportation by packhorse to ports and river barges .
The journey from Crinan to Oban was quite hair-raising .
We went together to Lantau , and travelled on a really hair-raising bus journey to a Buddhist monastery in the mountains .
After another couple of hair-raising bends , they entered the tiny village of Ham , where there was not a light to be seen .
It imported saltpetre from Sicily , used local charcoal and exported its produce over the bumpy roads to Maidstone , a rather hair-raising journey .
